            [public] => 1
            [use_default_menu_icon] => 1
            [label] => student
            [cctm_hierarchical_includes_drafts] => 1
            [cctm_hierarchical_post_types] => Array
                (

            [Submit] => Create New Content Type

            [custom_fields] => Array
                (
                    [portrait] => Array
                        (
                            [label] => Portrait
                            [name] => portrait
                            [default_value] =>

                        )

}}}

Note that each node of this array should be passable to the `register_post_type()` function below without any modification.  The keys that are not native to !WordPress are prefaced with "cctm_", e.g.  

 * *cctm_hierarchical_includes_drafts*: will cause !WordPress' parent selector to include unpublished pages
 * *cctm_hierarchical_post_types*: this determines which post types are viable candidates for parents.

 
= Settings =

Stores other settings used by this plugin, stored in the *wp_options* table under the key specified by the `CCTM::db_key_settings` key, currently *custom_content_types_mgr_settings*.

This is confusing and should be changed (e.g. `$candidate['candidate']` ... what?).

{{{
Array
(
    [export_info] => Array
        (
            [title] => My Students
            [author] => Everett
            [url] => http://www.fireproofsocks.com/
            [description] => Example
        )

    [candidate] => Array
        (
            [export_info] => Array
                (
                    [title] => Wild and Crazy
                    [author] => Everett
                    [url] => http://www.fireproofsocks.com/
                    [description] => Contains custom fields for books and authors
                    [_timestamp_export] => 1303780421
                    [_source_site] => http://pretasurf:8888
                    [_charset] => UTF-8
                    [_language] => en-US
                    [_wp_version] => 3.1.1
                    [_cctm_version] => 0.8.9
                )

            [candidate] => Array
                (
                    /* contains instance of what's in custom_content_types_mgr_data */
                )

            [payload] => Array
                (
                    /* contains instance of what's in custom_content_types_mgr_data */
                )

        )

)

}}}

= register_post_type =

For the record, this demonstrates sample input for !WordPress' `register_post_type()` function:

{{{
	$def = Array
	(
	    'supports' => Array
	        (
	            'title',
	            'editor'
	        ),

	    'post_type' => 'book',
	    'singular_label' => 'Book',
	    'label' => 'Books',
	    'description' => 'What I&#039;m reading',
	    'show_ui' => 1,
	    'capability_type' => 'post',
	    'public' => 1,
	    'menu_position' => '10',
	    'menu_icon' => '',
	    'show_in_nav_menus' => '',
	    'can_export' => '',
	    'is_active' => 1,
	);
}}}


= New Data Structure =

This is the proposed data structure planned for version 1.0

{{{
Array(
   [post_type_defs] => ... /* contains an instance of what's in custom_content_types_mgr_data, except the custom fields would contain only a list of references to the [custom_field_defs] */
   [custom_field_defs] => ... /* unique name for each field, should also include */
   [export_info] => Array
        (
            [title] => My Students
            [author] => Everett
            [url] => http://www.fireproofsocks.com/
            [description] => Example
        )
   [cctm_version] => '0.9.3.3'  /* used to test if we need to run updating scripts */
   [cctm_installation_timestamp] => 1303780421
   [cctm_update_timestamp] => 1303780421
)
}}}
